forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle before 2am, then a slight chance of rain showers between 2am and 3am, then a slight chance of drizzle between 3am and 4am, then a slight chance of rain showers. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. South wind 9 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers before 2pm. Partly sunny. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. Southwest wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 30 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the early hours of Sunday unfold, Downtown San Francisco finds itself under a cloak of humidity, with a whisper of drizzle still lingering in the air and shadows of moisture hovering lightly on the skyline. The clouds form a thick yet gentle blanket, suppressing the brilliance of dawn, while a mild breeze stirs through the streets, carrying the unmistakable scent of rain. The low temperature, resting comfortably around 54, gives way to a day that is expected to bring more than just the subtleties of drizzles; a curtain of rain showers will drop their quiet cadence before the afternoon light can properly fill the space.  

As the city awakens, a lingering marine layer rests over the Golden Gate, hinting at a day that may not fully reveal its splendor until later. The chance of precipitation looms large at 90%, painting the horizon with the promise of a few showers and possibly a damp afternoon, as temperatures hover at a comfortable 59 before dipping again. Those venturing outside would do well to don light layers, perhaps a waterproof jacket to combat the intermittent rain and a warm scarf to fend off the chill. Consider a stroll along the Embarcadero, where the blend of urban energy and the pulsing rhythm of the bay can be savored amidst the melange of falling droplets — the rain acting as a backdrop to the city’s diverse character, inviting introspection and quiet exploration amidst the clouds.
